name.value: Nations at War: Tigers in the Snow

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

Tigers in the Snow depicts the nail-biting combat during the Battle of the Bulge in our Nations At War series. In December of 1944 Hitler launched Wacht am Rhein (Watch on the Rhine) catching the Allies completely by surprise. The plan was to surprise the Allies with an encirclement attack which would force the allies into a peace treaty with terms favorable for the Axis. The end result would what would be the last German offensive of World War 2.
 Designed and developed by veteran Sean Druelinger, Tigers in the Snow will recreate some of the famous battles fought around Eisenborn Ridge in the north to Bastogne in the south, during the Battle of the Bulge. In the game, you can expect six gorgeous map boards with new terrain. Four counter sheets of 3/4" counters and various player aid cards. Special module rules covering limited fuel, German Commandos, and weather to name a few.

Description from the publisher:

It’s the fall of 1942, and the fight for Stalingrad is in full swing. In Victory Stalingrad, you will command either German and Soviet forces to recreate some of the most bloodiest battles of World War 2. Victory Stalingrad will take Nations at War fans into and around Stalingrad. Victory Stalingrad will feature the drive, and retreat from Stalingrad. This is the 5th core game in the Nations At War series. 
 We are expecting this game will include 5 to 6 map boards, 4 to 5 counter sheets of 3/4" counters and numerous player aid cards. Stalin’s Triumph uses the newly developed v2.0 Core Rules Edition and also includes our new design your own scenario generator. This will add hours of play to your game.

Description from the publisher:

Dungeon Mountain is a tabletop dungeon crawler for two players.

It is published as a play book, containing the rules, a space for custom rules and over 50 game boards.

A free, printable game board template and pocket rule book is also available.

The object of the game is to escape the other player's dungeon.
Each player creates a dungeon on an 8x8 grid. This contains a starting point and exit point. A class system can be used to predict the difficulty of a dungeon allowing for fair play or else to create a handicap for games between players of different experience.

Players place several items throughout the dungeon. These are Big Monsters, Small Monsters, Traps, Hammers and Gems. The position of these items does not change during gameplay.

Combat with Monsters is decided with attack points that are assigned when the monsters are placed.

On a second blank grid the players are given the starting coordinates. Players then navigate their opponents dungeon by calling out directions. Players continue their turn until they attempt a move into a wall or certain items. As they progress the players mark their progress on the grids.

The winner is the first player to exit the dungeon.
Number of lives used, monsters defeated and items collected can also be counted as points.

Imaginarium is a strategy, combination and development game.

From its Kickstarter description:


 Through the mist, you can just about see the gigantic form of the factory. This is where the essence of dreams is shaped! We will enter the factory through the grand entrance. Here are the famous machines! You can repair, combine or dismantle them. They will produce the resources needed to repair more powerful machines. I am sure that you will quickly make the best use of your resources and the space available in your workshop to carry out the projects of the design office and gain Victory points!

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

Spin-a-roo is a fun, fast-paced sorting and counting game with two ways to play! Early learners will enjoy the sorting game - a race to match the most numbers and colors on their card! Advanced learners will love the counting game- a race to collect the most tokens by counting up and down from one to ten! With a device that makes colorful tokens appear like magic, Spin-a-roo keeps young learners excited about practicing their sorting and counting skills. There are two ways to play:


 The Sorting Game (Green Side)*


The goal is to collect the most Tokens by making color and number matches on your card. A player is chosen to turn the Spinner Handle and fill all seven slots in the Spinner Tray. The chosen player should crank the handle around in a circle until it is back on the starting position. When any player sees a token that matches any color or number on his/her card, he/she calls out the number, takes the token, and places it on the matching space on his/her card. When no player can make a match, or the seven slots in the tray are empty, the next player (moving clockwise) cranks the handle a full turn to reload the slots. When there are no tokens left in the spinner handle and no more matches can be made by any player, players stack all the tokens they have collected. If you are the player with the tallest stack--YOU WIN!


 Counting Game (Purple Side)*


The goal is to collect the most tokens by counting up and down from one to ten! A player is chosen to turn the handle and fill all seven slots in the spinner tray. They should crank the handle around in a circle one full turn until it is back on the starting position. When any player sees a token that comes before or after any number on his/her card, he/she calls out the number, takes the token, and places it on the correct space on his/her card. Any number may be placed on the "WILD" space to start. When no player can make a match, or the seven slots in the Tray are empty, the next player (moving clockwise) cranks the handle a full turn to reload the slots. If your stack reaches 10, clear that stack and start over. The tokens that you have cleared will be counted toward your total points at the end of the round. When there are no Tokens left in the Spinner Handle and no more matches can be made by any player, players stack all the Tokens they have collected. If you are the player with the tallest stack--YOU WIN!

name.value: Van Gogh Walks into a Bar

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

It's the XIX century and famous Vincent Willem Van Gogh is up to party. Players will define his movement from bar to bar and will try to make him pass through their food stands to earn points. A game created in México during the Global Game Jam 2017.

During the set up, each player will place 6 food stands on the map, which is compounded by 3 sectors of 5 tiles x 6 tiles. Then, players will take turns to define 15 of Van Gogh's erratic movements. Each round, one of the players will play secretly so the other players won't know for sure where Van Gogh is located.

Players can get points if Van Gogh passes through one of their Food Stands or if Van Gogh wavelike movement matches one of the Path Cards that the players have. If Van Gogh would leave the table, players may lose points.

The game ends after each player had the chance to play secretly during a round. The player with the most points wins.

September 30, 1938. British Prime Minister leaves Munich with no agreement and no piece of paper to wave at a adoring crowd. In Prague, President Benes meets with his government and the decision to resist is made.

This game covers a hypothetical invasion of Czechoslovakia in October of 1938 after a failed meeting in München.
The Game OB's has all forces present in Oct of 38 plus those that appeared up until Dec of 38.

Contents:
560 counters
2 maps
Rulebook

name.value: 7s 11s: A Fast Paced Dice Game of Chance & Risk Taking

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

7s 11s is a dice scoring game where players take turns rolling three dice to make combinations that add to 7 or 11. A player's roll determines who contributes chips to the pot. Players take chances to improve their roll as they try to accumulate 100 or more points while avoiding the unlucky "triple", the same number on all three dice. Win the game and the chips are yours!

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

Fate Foretold is a tarot-inspired strategy card game where players race against one another to take control of Fate itself. Fate Foretold is honed and crafted to inspire hours of fun and epic gameplay for you and your friends. Gather around the table and take a turn at tempting fate. Use your wits and all the luck you can gather to make it through victorious! Pledge allegiance to kings, gain a spell from a witch, heed warnings in constellations, and use the power of the Four Horses of the Apocalypse to bring ruin to your enemies and emerge as the victor! Fate Foretold is a brilliantly illustrated creator-owned card game designed for 2 to 6 people.

name.value: StoryCards: Die drei ??? – Buch der Finsternis

item.description: StoryCards: Die drei ??? – Buch der Finsternis is a storytelling game of sorts in which a player or team is confronted by a situation that presents them with two options for a journey. Which way should they go to solve the mystery? Once they choose, they lay down the card, then search for the appropriately numbered card that they chose. The more cards they lay down, the more they score. If a card is no longer available, however, then the game ends and the detective trio has failed.

name.value: StoryCards: Die drei ??? Kids – Spuk im Schloss

item.description: StoryCards: Die drei ??? Kids – Spuk im Schloss is a storytelling game of sorts in which a player or team is confronted by a situation that presents them with two options for a journey. Which way should they go to solve the mystery? Once they choose, they lay down the card, then search for the appropriately numbered card that they chose. The more cards they lay down, the more they score. If a card is no longer available, however, then the game ends and the detective trio has failed.

name.value: StoryCards: Die Drei !!! – Labyrinth der Spiegel

item.description: StoryCards: Die Drei !!! – Labyrinth der Spiegel is a storytelling game of sorts in which a player or team is confronted by a situation that presents them with two options for a journey. Which way should they go to solve the mystery? Once they choose, they lay down the card, then search for the appropriately numbered card that they chose. The more cards they lay down, the more they score. If a card is no longer available, however, then the game ends and the detective trio has failed.

Try to score in Sokieba by throwing five soft colorful dice at the white target dice, which are placed two to five meters away from the throwers. You'll score based on the numbers indicated on the die you hit and the die you threw, so throw accurately and hope for the best!

"For each complex problem, there is an answer that is clear, simple, and false." —Donald Trump
"The proletarians have nothing to lose but their chains." —Heidi Klum

These are but two of the quotations that you'll find in Game of Quotes, but it's up to you to determine who didn't say them. In a round, each player chooses a quote, then attributes it to an incorrect source. Humorous combinations are rewarded by other players, and whoever scores the most wins.

item.description: In Feuerwehrmann Sam: Wasser marsch!, based on the television character "Feuerwehrmann Sam", players need to mend the broken firehose in order to save the inhabitants of Pontypandy. To do this, though, they need to find the matching parts that lie hidden underneath the firetruck Jupiter, and whoever finds the most matches wins.

Description from the publisher (translated):

Preserving life is our priority. Life on earth comes to an end. We must find a new planet capable of welcoming us as a species, allowing us to live in it and to which we can call home. For this, you will serve as Valkyries, arcane-technological ships that have been developed thanks to the discovery of some alien planes. To this day, these ships are already irreproducible. They are our key to the future. They are our last hope.

W.O.R.L.D.S. is a cooperative / competitive card game in which 2 to 4 players will try to be the first to find a planet fit for life, the new cradle of humanity.

In the course of the game, players will pilot their ships, the Valkyries, and will play planetary characteristics on the explored worlds, collaborating to find one that is totally suitable. Now, you have to be the first to achieve it... In addition, you have to get it before the earth loses all hope of being saved.

W.O.R.L.D.S. is composed of 24 world tarot size cards, with the aid of which we will travel with our Valkyries to find a planet where all humanity can be transferred. To check if a planet is fit for life, we will have 60 planetary characteristics counters. And to direct our Valkyrie we will use command panel letters and navigation cubes in order to achieve our goal. But do not lose sight of the fact that the planet Earth does not have much time left and that we have to reach our goal before the asteroids end all trace of life.

Description from the publisher:
Preservar la vida es nuestra prioridad. La vida en la tierra llega a su fin. Debemos encontrar un nuevo planeta capaz de acogernos como especie, que nos permita vivir en él y al que podamos llamar hogar. Para ello, os serviréis de las valquirias, naves arcano-tecnológicas que han sido desarrolladas gracias al descubrimiento de unos planos alienígenas. A día de hoy, estas naves son ya irreproducibles. Son nuestra llave hacia el futuro. Son nuestra última esperanza. 
W.O.R.L.D.S. es un juego de cartas cooperativo/competitivo en el que de 2 a 4 jugadores intentarán ser los primeros en hallar un planeta apto para la vida, la nueva cuna de la humanidad. 
En el transcurso del juego, los jugadores pilotarán sus naves, las valquirias, y jugarán características planetarias sobre los mundos explorados, colaborando para hallar uno que sea totalmente idóneo. Ahora bien, hay que ser el primero en lograrlo... Además, hay que conseguirlo antes de que la tierra pierda toda la esperanza de ser salvada. 
W.O.R.L.D.S. está compuesto por 24 cartas de mundo hallado de tamaño tarot, gracias a las que viajaremos con nuestras valquirias para encontrar un planeta donde se pueda trasladar toda la humanidad. Para poder comprobar si un planeta es apto para la vida, contaremos con 60 fichas de características planetarias. Y para dirigir nuestra valquiria utilizaremos cartas de panel de mando y cubos de navegación para poder conseguir nuestro objetivo. Pero no hay que perder de vista que al planeta tierra no le queda mucho tiempo y que hay que alcanzar nuestro objetivo antes de que los asteroides acaben con todo rastro de vida.
Si queréis saber más sobre W.O.R.L.D.S. seguid atentos. Iremos publicando todos nuestros avances por encontrar un planeta que sea apto para acogernos.

Be the first to build an awesome sandwich. But beware of the mice, they want your cheese!

Each player has a sandwich with six ingredients they need to collect to complete the sandwich. Players start with three random ingredients and then on each turn, they can either choose a random ingredient from the pile in the center or they can ask another player if they have a certain ingredient. If you draw an ingredient, check to see if you can add it to your sandwich, if not put it behind your fridge. If you draw a mouse, it eats a piece of cheese from your sandwich(if you have one). The mouse is then removed from the game and the cheese goes back in the center pile.

Play continues until someone finished their sandwich.

name.value: The Powerpuff Girls: Saving Townsville Before Bedtime!

item.description:
Watch out! Townsville has been taken over by villains and only the Powerpuff Girls can help!

This is a cooperative game where the players will work together to move the Powerpuff girls around the board to uncover villains to fight. Each Powerpuff Girl can fight alone (using the dice with erasable sides) or can work together to fight stronger villains. But after each turn, time will pass and the professor will move along the time track (leading to bedtime). Defeat 5 villains, including Mojo Jojo, before bedtime and you win!

Description from the designer:

An abstract game for 2 players. Players decide to either act as the Spirit of the Sun God or as Noble Explorers mistaken for Grave Robbers. While the Explorers work to find each other, the Spirit works to bring down the temple upon them.

Each turn consists of the two players selecting a certain number of spirit stones in secret. After the selection is complete the combined number of spirit stones of the two players determines the action for the turn.

The goal of the game is to escape if you are the Explorers, or stop the escape if you are the Spirits.

Description from the desinger:

Yukon Salon is a creative, fast-paced card game for 2-4 players competing to be the best stylist in the Yukon by styling hairdos for Grizzly Bears and beards for Lumberjacks. If you're lucky this game might turn up and you too can experience what it's like to have a copy, until the creator responds on Kickstarter you'll just have to read this and pretend that he cares.

Each client that you style rewards you with a combination of points to win the game and abilities and bonuses to help attempt riskier styles on more difficult clients.

Sway the clients into choosing your style by making outrageous, unique claims and press your luck to earn the right mix of points and rewards.

Description from the publisher:"

In the party game Invisible Ink, one player assumes the role of the double agent who must wear special tinted glasses, roll the dice, and throw down the marker. So far everything seems simple, but the difficulty is that the double agent can not really figure out what is being drawn through the tinted lenses of his glasses..

Draw without looking!
Guess without seeing!!

item.description: Bullyparade: Der Film – Das Brettspiel is a game. More to follow.

Description from the publisher:

Extinction Crisis is a Co-operative board game for 1-6 players. Working together as a team, players must stabilize the global populations of amphibians, birds, mammals, and reptiles before time runs out or the damage done to the planet’s biodiversity is beyond repair.

Using unique character skills, combined with team strategy and a bit of luck, players travel the globe encountering real-world destruction events and conservation strategies as they try to bring an end to the worldwide Extinction Crisis. The overall health of the global animal populations is tracked on the Population Growth Index (PGI) chart on the board. For victory, each animal population must be “stabilized” by raising its PGI marker above the zero value. The primary method to do this is for a player to successfully complete a Reaction card during their turn. These scientifically accurate cards are a major determining factor towards the team’s overall success.

However, at the start of each player’s turn an Occurrence Card is drawn. These cards guide the story and introduce real-world events and challenges that must be overcome. But be careful… Just when you think you’re in the clear you could be hit with a Destruction Event, causing an entire species to become endangered or a local habitat to be destroyed. Other actions allow players to meet these challenges and progress towards their final objective. Players must also pay attention to the health of the world’s waterways, invertebrates, and plants. Neglect any of the 3 main charts (PGI, IP, and Ocean) for too long and the consequences could be disastrous: a smart team balances the needs of all 3 charts continuously throughout the game to achieve victory.

Extinction Crisis presents players with a daunting task and requires them to find solutions, adapt to challenges, and overcome the very real crisis facing the planet. With only 10 turns each, how will you rise to the occasion?

Japan in the late Middle ages. Acting as shoguns, players in TAâ€KE try to consolidate their power and expand their influence in the empire. To this end, you select people that you appoint to the emperor's court. But is the person chosen well and are his skills currently useful to the shogun? Only if you use clever tactics, plan ahead, and keep a close eye on your opponent can you assert your position at court and thus win the game.

item.description: Wonderword is a game with the aim to guess words formed by other players, starting from the last letter of the word. Points are awarded both to players who guess right and to those who form challenging words and succeed in revealing as many letters as possible, before a successful guess is made. The first player to reach 24 points wins the game.

User summary:
Players use sets of heroes cards in order to defeat villains that come from a separate villains deck. There is also a joker and two trump cards.
An optional companion app keeps interrupting play, asking players to make impressions and find specific cards. All cards have printed codes to accomplish this.

Description from the publisher:
"Os vilões do Reino de Ooo estão à solta! Ajudem Finn, Joke, Beemo, Princesa Jujuba e Marceline a capturá-los. Enfrente vários desafios e descubra quem é o vencedor.
Junte seus amigos e divirta-se com essa nova experiência!"

'Every spring, it's time for the magical tree to be reborn. As one of the tree's spirit guardians, you are trying to grow the tree based on your preferences, but you aren't the only sylvan spirit out there and everyone seeks to promote their own charming fruit. Will you be clever enough to place all your items before your competitors do? Enter this magical place and return the tree to the splendor it deserves.

Each turn in L'Arbre, a player either draws cards from the deck or places their tiles on the tree by playing cards from their hand. Each tile represents a tree element (branches, leaves, buds or fruits) with distinct rules for placement. The first player to have exhaust their tiles wins.

name.value: Robbi, Tobbi und das Fliewatüüt: Die Roboterprüfung

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Robbi, Tobbi und das Fliewatüüt: Die Roboterprüfung, Robbi and Tobbi are ready for the next robot test and now have to find new mysterious and hidden places and persons. Sitting in the helicopter cockpit, the players set course and head off on their journey — but is the triangular castle in the north or rather to the east? With skill, luck and good memory, the players will discover the places they seek and move the Fliewatüüt in the right direction.
Get ready to tell all new stories in the Land of Ooo with Rory's Story Cubes: Adventure Time, which features all the well-known characters.

Description from the publisher:

Creature Quest is the board game that teaches kids how positive & negative numbers work. Just pick up a card, follow its instructions, and go. Be the first to reach the treasure in the castle - but don't get turned to stone by Medusa!

In 1566, Jean Parisot de Valette, 49th Grand Master of the Order of Malta, laid the foundation for Valletta, the future capital of Malta.

In Valletta, players take inspiration from Jean Parisot de Valette in order to procure raw materials; hire merchants, bricklayers and roofers; and build their own version of the magnificent capital, with its mighty bastions, baroque buildings, and a right-angled street network. Cultivate your contacts with the Order of Malta to improve your reputation.

Players are supervised in their work by de Valette, who patrols his streets as a building inspector. When he reaches the end of his patrol, the game ends and a winner is determined.

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

Pitch Deck is a game where you and your friends make ridiculous, creative pitches for objectively bad startup ideas. Combine a Pitch card from your hand with a Company card on the table to create a new business. Then everyone makes a quick elevator pitch describing what their company does. One person plays an investor, who decides which company everyone will secretly fund that round. At the end of the game, the funding amounts are revealed, and there are two winners: the person who pitched the most valuable company and the person who invested the most in that company.

Description from the publisher:

Long ago, in a remote village at the edge of the kingdom, lived a Troll. This Troll roamed the streets demanding a toll from any traveller he met; if they refused to pay, he would steal their trousers. One day the Troll stopped a merchant travelling along the road. As usual, he demanded the merchant pay the toll in order to pass undisturbed. The merchant, who was very cunning, made the Troll a proposal…

Trade & Troll is an easy to play game as the rules and the main mechanism can be learned in about 20 minutes. The real challenge lies in how to best suit each player’s strategy to the developing situation on the board.

Players represent a merchant whose goal is to arrange an efficient production line from the collection of basic resources to their manufacturing and consequent trading in market stands. Each turn players can build resource/stall/market tiles, cobble a road or collect money from tiles they already possess.

At the end of the game, when the board representing the developing village is completely constructed, the player who owns the most developed market web, combined with the victory points collected differently during the game, wins.

Unfortunately, things become more complicated as a troll arrives in the village! The control of this character swaps each turn after a fierce auction between players, and the one who finally gets it has the opportunity to block the opponents’ trades until the end of the turn.

Trade & Troll is a European-style game for 2 to 6 players created by Good & Evil Games. It features a double-sided board map of T&T kingdom, 120 high-quality illustrated tiles, 73 wooden meeples, and numerous illustrated tokens.

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

Hammerhal. Built in the glorious image of Azyrheim, the seat of the God-King Sigmar’s power. Within its walls can be found danger and beauty, faith and intrigue, poverty and fortune. From the gleaming crystal spires of Goldenpath to the mist-shrouded vineways of Ghyra-un-Tyr, there is seemingly no end to its marvels. Yet most who witness this splendour know little of the danger and menace that fill the outer districts of the city, and that which lurks below…

A band of heroes has been brought together by circumstance, and are bound to hunt down and nullify a sinister Chaos plot in the dungeons and catacombs below Hammerhal. Lord-Castellant Arvios Sunhelm, his Gryph-hound Archimaine and Cogsmith Golnir Coalbeard are joined by Loremaster Alnaryn and Fleetmaster Vizrin Kyre, as they quest to uncover the Chaos Sorcerer Lord Redomir and put a halt to the vile corruption of the First City of Order.

Warhammer Quest: Shadows Over Hammerhal is a boxed game for 2-5 players, set in – and below – the splendid city of Order, Hammerhal. Up to 4 players can quest in the catacombs and dungeons below the city, while another acts as gamemaster, setting fiendish obstacles, controlling the antagonists and setting the story – it’s up to this player to take charge of revealing the secrets each dungeon has to offer.

After each adventure, the heroes can spend time in the Cinderfall district of the city, visiting shops, resting and taking part in the various shadowy delights Hammerhal has to offer! Your characters level up and increase their skills as you play, and Warhammer Quest: Shadows Over Hammerhal is completely compatible with the Warhammer Quest: Silver Tower Hero Cards – any miniatures or rules you already own for that game can be used here.

Speaking of miniatures, Warhammer Quest: Shadows Over Hammerhal includes an impressive 31:


 a Lord-Castellant;
 a Gryph-hound;
 a Cogsmith;
 a Black Ark Fleetmaster;
 a Loremaster;
 a Chaos Sorcerer Lord;
 5 Putrid Blightkings;
 10 Kairic Acolytes;
 10 Bloodreavers.


As well as this, the box includes a 72-page guidebook, a 32-page adventure book for the gamemaster to use, 18 double-sided board sections, 55 cards, 12 dice and a variety of counters and markers for tracking your heroes as they gain experience and skills under the city of Hammerhal.

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

WordSpiel is a simple yet dynamic card game in which you need to use your words wisely and be the first to go out. Word size doesn't matter, but ending with a tricky letter can really challenge your opponents! Each word spins off the last, so the game is never the same twice!

In more detail, the goal is to get rid of all ten of your cards by making words. Each turn, start your word with the last card played, just as "Spiel" uses the "s" from "Words" in the title of this game.

Description from the publisher:

Sicaliptic is an erotic game for two players. (+18)

During the game the players propose each other a combination of an action and a body part from the cards of their hand.

Then, players thow the die. Depending on the number obtained, the player who chose even or odd numbers previously, wins.

The winner throws the die again and the number obtained will be the number of times (or seconds) that the other player must do the action proposed.

The winner will add a point in his own score indicator.

Each player will level up as they win rounds, and the exposed body parts will become more intimate as they do so.

The game will end when one of the players arrives to the end of the score indicator and the loser one becomes completely naked.

In the bleak future, after the collapse of our modern technological world, most of the structures we hold dearly today are no longer effective. The things that brought us comfort and ease have fallen into disrepair and disuse. Central governments have given way to localized strongmen. In some places the world is nothing but a vast wasteland and in other locals mankind thrives by calling back to its pre-modern lifestyle.

Through it all men still choose to compete and challenge each other in the various arenas. Auto racing is one of these sports that will not die. But the rules no longer apply. The racing circuits are no longer about speed and guile. Now they resemble high speed demolition derbies. The most famous organized racing competition of them all, the Apocalypse Road, is run by callous thugs and monsters who encourage drivers to arm their cars and literally destroy their opponents. It is the Roman Coliseum reincarnated.

Over time, new rules and organizational structures have taken hold. Ten teams now complete across the Thunderverse in a season-long show of firepower and twisted metal. Drivers work as part of a team struggling to complete laps under machine gun and even missile fire. The tracks, falling into decades of disrepair, are a jumbled mess of jumps, joker lanes and dirt. Much like the gladiators of old, in a time of intense anguish, the chance to be a hero, even for a day, calls drivers out to risk life and limb for wealth and food. The arena beckons, will you take the wheel?

Apocalypse Road is a race game using the Thunder Alley/Grand Prix engine. Players attempt to score points by crossing the finish line (somewhat like roller derby) and by eliminating opposing cars. The first team to 15 points wins the event and gets a double portion of foodstuffs as a reward.

In Apocalypse Road, a race is played to the accumulation of 15 skins for a team. A Skin may be scored in two ways.

Each time a car crosses the Finish Line is worth 1 Skin.
 Each opposing car that is eliminated during your activation is worth 1 Skin.
 There is no leading and there is no tracking of lapped cars.

Floh am Po is a vacation-themed kids’ roll-and-move game of fleas clinging tightly to the fur of big wooden dogs (thanks to Velcro).

Each player has their own dog that they want to be the very first to reach the destination. The more fleas a dog is carrying the faster it will run. If it's your turn, you roll colored dice hoping that fleas will jump off the other dogs and onto yours.

Advanced rules are also included.

item.description:
Misch Masch is the hybrid-animal card game for the whole family that combines Crazy Eights and Dominoes while doing away with downtime. Whoever gets rid of all their cards in hand first wins.

To this end, you may play a card that shows a hybrid-animal that shares one characteristic with the last card played, whenever it is your turn. However, everybody else is allowed to play "out of turn" and interrupt you. All they need is an animal that happens to be a perfect match.

item.description:
Café Fatal is a lively dice game that lets players go toe-to-toe with each other as everyone is trying to complete their sets and collect big points.

The aim of the game is to collect as many high-scoring delicacies as possible. These can be found on tables, which the players try to call dibs on. When it is your turn, you place all the dice of one value on one of the tables. You can either add them to dice that you already placed or put them on a neighboring table. At the end of a round, more dice beat fewer dice and more pips beat fewer pips.

item.description:
Yam Yam is a card game that lets young children decide how much longer their hedgehog family can safely stay outside to eat before snow suddenly starts to fall.

Before the beginning of winter, all hedgehogs have to be fast asleep. As soon as a hedgehog sleeps, however, it can no longer help gather food. That's why you will have to think twice after each food card that you draw — whether it really is time already for another one of your hedgehogs to hibernate.

Contents: 
60 game cards, divided into:
16 hedgehog cards in 4 colors
40 food cards
4 winter cards

item.description:
Everything comes together when players strategically place pieces onto the magnetic board. Create the most circles to score points while sabotaging your opponents' scoring opportunities. With single player and multi-player options, the fun is endless with Zircles!

Contents: 48 pieces, 32 scoring markers, magnetic travel case with board, and instructions

- Easy-to-learn puzzle game where players strategically place pieces on to the board to score points
- Each piece must be placed adjacent to pieces of a different color - make your move to score or to sabotage your opponents
- Magnetic puzzle pieces to keep them from shifting around the board
- Great reply value with solo play for high scoring
- For 2 - 4 players ages 10 and up, with average game time of 30 minutes per game

Normandy, June 9, 1944. You have survived the brutal invasion of Omaha Beach, but your mission is not complete. You have been given new high-priority orders from General George C. Marshall to locate a missing paratrooper, Private First Class James Francis Ryan, and bring him home to safety.

Private Ryan’s whereabouts are unknown. Rumors place him directly in the middle of enemy-occupied territory laden with snipers, minefields, deadly tanks, and heavily fortified villages.

You have been made Captain and placed in charge of this mission. With limited intel and an even smaller chance of success, you gather a team, ready your equipment, and set off to bring Private Ryan home.

'D-Day Express: Saving Private Ryan' is a solo wargame played using a single deck of double-sided cards. There are no counters and no record-keeping is needed to play. Cards are used to represent terrain, enemies, friendly units, damage, mines, debris, and hills, as well as used to generate random events, direct enemy fire, manage close combat engagements, and even determine whether snipers are successful in hitting their targets.

'D-Day Express: Saving Private Ryan' is a portable, compelling wargame experience that is easy to set up, quick to take down, perfect for travel and gaming in tight spaces, and most importantly, is fun to play! Just shuffle the cards and play!

Description from the publisher:

THE FOREST IS UNDER ATTACK, AND ONLY YOU CAN SAVE IT!

The evil LUMBERCO wants to cut down protected forests! These lumberjacks will STOMP, DYNAMITE, and SNEAK through a forest to make room for their big, bad bulldozers and tree-chopping chainsaws! Only the forest animals and their friends can stop them now!

As the forest animals, players setup BEARICADES and recruit PREDATORS (like The Cougar, The Bat, or The Wolf Pack), to defend against the incoming hordes of lumberjacks.

It’s SURVIVAL OF THE FOREST – use guile, strategy, and power of the forest creatures to save your forest. An environmentally contentious card game for 2 to 4 players.

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the land of Banana Republic, an incompetent and corrupted government has caused a wave of crime and lawlessness in Banana Republic.

A few brave souls have finally showed and decided to take on the mantle of heros - to combat the Villains who are stealing the hard earned savings of ordinary citizens. However, beneath every hero lies an average human being, who has a job to perform, daily expenses to pay and crime fighting gadgets to buy. Little did they know that their credit card bills are feeding the ultimate monster of mass destruction: Debtzilla.

Debtzilla is a 2 to 4 player, cooperative board game in which heroes work together to protect ordinary citizens from being scammed by Villains, and take down the final boss: Debtzilla. Sharing the same universe as Wongamania: Banana Economy, Debtzilla focuses on the issue of how debt affects the lives of ordinary people in Banana Republic. Using a combination of deck building and dice mechanics, players have to race against time to bring down the bad guys before the law of compounding debt interest destroys their chances of winning the game. Be too stingy on your finances and you will find your hero too weak to do any good in a real fight. On the other hand, splurging too much on those flashy hero gadgets on borrowed money will result in the final boss too difficult to defeat. Can you balance your books and save the world at the same time?

With Great Power Comes Great Debt!

Components

 4 playing board
 6 hero cards
 108 income cards
 18 basic gadget cards
 11 advanced gadget cards 
 16 villain cards
 10 citizen cards 
 25 dice
 58 Wonga coins 
 12 insurance shields
 4 hero meeples
 4 happiness markers
 3 citizen wealth markers
 2 boss life markers
 11 Debtzilla boss cards
 9 Inflationsaurus boss cards

item.description: Valtaa hansalaiva is Finnish and translates into capture Hanseatic Ship. The game is part of Finnish Public Television's (YLE) historical educational series covering the pirates on the Baltic Sea in the early 15th century. Players are divided in two crews led by historic pirates Klaus Störtebecker and Birgit Fleming. The game is won by the crew that is able to first capture half of the 13 cabins and the captain's cabin. You are capturing cabins by rolling 5 or 6 with D6 while in the conquer space of a cabin. Member of the opposing crew in the same room can counter your capture attempt by rolling a 1.

In Candy Match, players place cards depicting one to three sweets. As soon as a player finds a card combination in which all the candy depicted is in pairs, they call "Candy match" and show their solution. If the symbol pairs are correct, the player receives all the cards involved in the matches; if they're wrong, each other player takes one card from the center of the table. Once the draw pile is exhausted and no more combinations can be found, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

item.description:
From the publisher

The intuitive gameplay, different levels of difficulty and different game modes offer a satisfying puzzle experience. The independent Emoji 2 also provides for many new funny puzzles. Thus, unsuspecting players soon become uncontrolled puzzles, which they can assemble with the new cards themselves.

Description from the publisher:

In Santo Domingo, all players have the same set of eight action cards. Each round, they choose one or two (depending on the number of players), reveal them at the same time, then execute the actions in a fixed order. This allows the players to collect goods, exchange them for victory points, or even receive victory points directly. However, with a limited supply of goods and points in each round, the strength of a card depends on which cards the others have played.

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

Stand alone sequel & expansion to Pixel Glory!

New features include:
Two new elements! Light and Shadow.
Fully revamped dungeon phase
New player health system
Cooperative, hidden traitor, and solo game modes.

Team up with fellow wizards to vanquish the sinister monsters that lurk in the dungeon, and save the nearby village. This is a noble and honorable quest, and... oh, who are we kidding? In reality, you're a greedy wizard who is all about fame and personal gain, and your fellow wizards are cut from the same cloth! Prevail over your opponents by learning the best spells and using that knowledge to outmaneuver and kill-steal in the dungeon, so you can gain admiration of the townsfolk, fame across the realm, and achieve Pixel Glory.

In the first phase, the town phase, players will be drafting spells using an auction mechanic. Players will then take their decks into the second phase, the dungeon phase, where they will work together to defeat monsters; however, only the player that deals the lethal blow will get the fame for it. There is a lot of interaction and engagement due to players fighting over learning the same spells as well as fighting over fame.

item.description: The Spetsnaz have arrived in the Middle-East! Deployed alongside any SSU force, the Spetsnaz Assault Squads provide intelligence and are able to communicate efficiently with fire support units should they encounter any threat. These are even sneakier and deadlier Spetsnaz than the rest!
A roll and move set collection game where players race to assemble a team of players (and a manager/coach). The game incorporates cards that can be collected and traded.
